articles.description: Wales become the first team to reach the 2023 World Cup quarter-finals as they celebrate a record win over Australia in Lyon.
articles.title: Wales hammer Australia to seal quarter-final spot

articles.description: Newcastle match their record Premier League win with a scintillating display as they embarrass winless Sheffield United at Bramall Lane.
articles.title: Rampant Newcastle put eight past winless Sheff Utd

articles.description: Spain's Carlota Ciganda sensationally holes the putt that sees Europe retain the Solheim Cup as they tie 14-14 with the United States in her homeland.
articles.title: Europe retain Solheim Cup with 14-14 tie with US

articles.description: Everything about Tottenham's performance in the 2-2 draw at Arsenal suggests Ange Postecoglou knows the right direction for a club that had lost its way, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: 'Spurs making big strides under Postecoglou'

articles.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Shay Given and Ian Wright analyse how Newcastle United exposed Sheffield United's defensive frailties in their 8-0 win at Bramall Lane.
articles.title: How Newcastle exposed 'terrible' Sheffield United

articles.description: Seven tries and missed opportunities, reckless hits and more TMO bunker controversy, Scotland's win over Tonga wasn't perfect but the team are still fighting for World Cup progress.
articles.title: Scotland dominate to get job done amid Tonga tempest

articles.description: Everyone in the paddock is in awe of what Red Bull - and mainly Max Verstappen - have achieved this year.
articles.title: Verstappen shrugs off doubters with crushing statement win'

articles.description: Watch some of the best shots as Europe retain the Solheim Cup after tying 14-14 with the United States on a thrilling final day at Finca Cortesin in Spain.
articles.title: Europe retain Solheim Cup after thrilling final day

articles.description: Chelsea's stuttering start to the Premier League season takes another turn for the worse as Aston Villa pile more misery on the 10-man Blues.
articles.title: Watkins winner piles more misery on 10-man Chelsea

articles.description: Darwin Nunez scores a fine goal as Liverpool see off West Ham to extend their unbeaten run to 18 games.
articles.title: Nunez helps fire Liverpool to win over West Ham
